0.title: People are not able to see me outside the garb of a woman: Ali Asgar
0.article_body: Ali Asgar said he feels typecast as an actor and stated, "My image as...comedian is so strong that...people don't consider me for any other role." "They are not able to see me outside the garb of a woman," he added. Talking about his exit from 'The Kapil Sharma Show', Ali said, "I wasn't creatively satisfied, as my character wasn't growing."

1.title: Hyderabad Police warn citizens about rise in cybercrimes
1.article_body: The Hyderabad Police warned citizens about rise in cybercrime cases by organised gangs who are convincing people to rent their bank accounts in exchange for money. The warning comes after the bank account of a woman from Maharashtra was used for cheating several people for online investments. The police said that the targets are usually unemployed and low salaried people.

2.title: It's my dream story: Puri Jagannadh on Vijay Deverakonda's 'JGM'
2.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh shared that his next film 'JGM: Jana Gana Mana' is his "dream story", which he wrote almost a decade back. He shared, "It's a very big film and we have got international technicians on board. We are planning a big schedule in Morocco next month." 'JGM' marks Puri and Vijay Deverakonda's second collaboration after 'Liger'.

3.title: 31-yr-old techie found dead in Hyderabad flat under mysterious circumstances
3.article_body: A 31-year-old software engineer was found dead in his Hyderabad apartment under mysterious circumstances, police said on Wednesday. The deceased was identified as Y Bhargava Reddy, a native of Andhra Pradesh's Krishna district, who was staying with friends, Sai Sandeep and Jaswant, police said. On Tuesday, when Sandeep returned to Hyderabad, he found Reddy lying dead in his bedroom.

4.title: India-made SSI Mantra's 5 robotic arms to benefit underserved: Study
4.article_body: London-based GlobalData said that India-made multi-arm novel tele robotic assistance (Mantra) surgical robotic system will help provide cost-effective robotic surgical treatment for underserved population globally. The system was recently launched by India-based startup SS Innovations. According to the report, India's robotic surgical systems market is likely to reach 45 million in value in 2030.

5.title: BJP will create history again, touch 350 seats in 2024 polls: Shekhawat
5.article_body: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Wednesday said BJP will create history again in the upcoming 2024 Lok Sabha elections and win over 350 seats. "The way popularity of PM Narendra Modi is increasing continuously in the country, it's evident that people want him to win again," Shekhawat said. "In Bihar, we've set a target of 35 seats," he added.

6.title: Protests break out in Kerala as student dresses up as Savarkar for I-Day parade
6.article_body: Protests broke out in a school in Kerala's Malappuram district amid Independence Day celebrations, after a school student dressed up as VD Savarkar for a procession. The students had dressed up as freedom fighters, but the aforementioned student dressed up as Savarkar, despite his name not being listed as a freedom fighter.

7.title: It's 'inevitable': Ponting on Boult giving up his NZ central contract
7.article_body: Reacting to New Zealand pacer Trent Boult giving up his central contract, Ricky Ponting said, "It's inevitable...We'll...hear more about this in the coming years." "For someone like Trent Boult, and no disrespect to New Zealand at all, but I'm sure their national contracts are...only reflective of maybe what he'd make in one of these T20 domestic tournaments," added Ponting.

8.title: Cricketing leagues should be taken forward 'carefully': Ashwin
8.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin said the future of international cricket will be "largely affected" by franchise cricket. "The IPL window has also been extended," added Ashwin. "We should take the leagues forward carefully," he stated. Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting stated it's getting "harder & harder" to maintain the full schedule of international cricket, with the emergence of T20 domestic tournaments.

9.title: SRH name their new CSA T20 League franchise 'Sunrisers Eastern Cape'
9.article_body: The Sunrisers Hyderabad have announced the name of their South African franchise for the CSA T20 League to be "Sunrisers Eastern Cape". Notably, all six participating teams at the CSA T20 League have been acquired by IPL franchise owners. Sunrisers Eastern Cape have also named South Africa batter Aiden Markram and pacer Ottniel Baartman as their first two signings.

10.title: Gold trades flat ahead of release of Fed's policy meeting minutes
10.article_body: Gold prices in India were trading flat to negative on Wednesday even as they traded flat globally ahead of the release of the minutes of US Federal Reserve's latest policy meeting. Gold October futures were trading at ₹51,807 per 10 gram on the Multi Commodity Exchange. Spot gold was flat at $1,775.59/ounce, while US gold futures were steady at $1,788.80/ounce.

11.title: Bihar developments will have zero impact on UP polls: Keshav Maurya
11.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said the political developments in Bihar will have "zero" impact on the 2024 general elections in UP. By joining hands with RJD and Congress, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has positioned himself in a difficult situation, Maurya said. He further asserted that SP and Congress will lose their strongholds in the 2024 UP elections.

12.title: Madras HC grants 'no caste, no religion' certificate to 3-yr-old in Chennai
12.article_body: Madras HC has directed authorities to issue a 'no caste, no religion' certificate to a three-year-old boy in Chennai. The boy was denied admission to a school after his parents denied to mention their caste or community. His father then filed the petition. Tamil Nadu government's earlier orders mandate schools to not insist parents to mention their caste or community.

13.title: SBI branch in Pune vacated after fan in basement catches fire
13.article_body: The premises of a State Bank of India (SBI) branch in Pune's Karve Road was vacated after a fan in the basement locker room caught fire on Wednesday morning. No casualties or loss of property, other than the fan, were reported. A fire station officer said, "Intense smoke was coming from...basement...Firefighters controlled the fire...[in] less than half an hour."

14.title: After minister's tweet, Centre clarifies 'No orders to provide flats to Rohingyas in Delhi'
14.article_body: Centre has clarified it hasn't given directions to provide EWS flats to illegal Rohingya migrants in Delhi. This comes after Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri tweeted, "In a landmark decision, all Rohingya refugees will be shifted to EWS flats in Bakkarwala area of Delhi." Centre asked Delhi government to ensure Rohingyas are kept at their present location for their deportation.

15.title: Shefali Shah tests positive for COVID-19
15.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has tested positive for COVID-19. In a note, which she shared on Instagram, Shefali said she has isolated herself and will be under home quarantine. She said she is following all the safety protocols as instructed by her doctor. "Requesting everyone who came in contact with me to get tested immediately too," she wrote.

16.title: India's fixtures for next 2 World Test Championships released
16.article_body: ICC today released fixtures for next two World Test Championships. In the 2023-25 cycle, India will host New Zealand, England and Bangladesh, while India's away series will be against Australia, West Indies and South Africa. In the 2025-27 cycle, India will host Australia, West Indies and South Africa and play their overseas series against New Zealand, England and Sri Lanka.

17.title: Modi ko hatana hai: Lalu vows to oust 'dictatorial' govt in 2024 LS polls
17.article_body: RJD leader Lalu Prasad Yadav on Wednesday took a jibe at the BJP-led Central government and said, "Hatana hai, Modi ko hatana hai". "We have to oust the dictatorial government," Yadav said, when asked about the 2024 LS polls. "Sushil Modi is a liar," Yadav said, when asked about Modi's statements about the formation of a new government in Bihar.

18.title: Only concern is Virat hasn't played too many T20Is: Rajkumar on Asia Cup
18.article_body: Talking about the upcoming Asia Cup, Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma has said there's a "slight concern" that Kohli hasn't played too many T20Is this year. Rajkumar, however, also added that Kohli is coming back "refreshed" following his break after the England tour. Kohli has only played four T20Is in 2022 so far.

19.title: Expect Patna HC to take serious notice: RS Prasad on Bihar minister facing arrest
19.article_body: BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad commented on Bihar Law Minister Kartikeya Singh’s allegedly outstanding arrest warrant on Wednesday. "We expect Patna HC to take serious notice of this. I expect CM Nitish Kumar to show some courage," Prasad said. "Kartikeya Singh should be sacked and strict action should be taken against him," he added.

20.title: Flipkart fined ₹1 lakh for sale of substandard pressure cookers
20.article_body: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has imposed a penalty of ₹1,00,000 on Flipkart for allowing the sale of substandard domestic pressure cookers on its platform. The e-commerce platform has been asked to inform consumers of the 598 pressure cookers sold on its platform, recall the pressure cookers and reimburse money to the consumers, CCPA Chief Commissioner Nidhi Khare said.

21.title: Bengaluru's Sir CV Raman Road to be closed for a month
21.article_body: Sir CV Raman Road in north Bengaluru will be closed for traffic for 30 days as white topping (concrete layering) work will be done on it, police said. Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will start the concrete layering work on Thursday. Traffic diversions have been put in place using the stretch from BHEL Circle to Yeshwanthpur Circle.

22.title: FPI stock holding drops 14% to $523 bn in June quarter: Report
22.article_body: The value of the foreign portfolio investors (FPI) holdings in Indian equities dropped 14% to $523 billion in the quarter ended June as against $612 billion in the previous quarter, according to a Morningstar report. The value of FPIs' investments in Indian equities has declined for three consecutive quarters. US Federal Reserve's aggressive stance dented the sentiments of foreign investors.

23.title: Fly down from London every weekend: Janhvi on craziest thing done by a boy
23.article_body: Talking about the "craziest" thing done for her by a boy, during an interview, actress Janhvi Kapoor said he would fly down from London "every weekend" to see her. "I've broken up...because he didn't order me a chicken salad," Janhvi had shared about her previous relationships. Discussing her "strange" habits, Janhvi stated she needs to eat ice-cream every two hours.

24.title: upGrad appoints Myleeta Aga Williams as CEO for international ops
24.article_body: Mumbai-based edtech unicorn upGrad has appointed Myleeta Aga Williams as the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) for its international business. Aga Williams will be spearheading operations across the Asia-Pacific, Middle East, Africa, Europe and the United States regions. Earlier, she managed diverse portfolios and led marketing and sales teams at Netflix, BBC Studios, Discovery and UTV.

25.title: One dead, 11 injured as neighbours clash over parking in UP's Bhadohi
25.article_body: One person died and 11 others were injured after an argument over parking a motorcycle in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi district turned violent, police said. The incident occurred on Tuesday when one faction parked motorcycle in front of the door of another. Twelve people belonging to both sides were injured, following which they were rushed to the district hospital, police added.

26.title: Retail sales continue to surpass pre-COVID levels, up 18% in July: RAI
26.article_body: Retail businesses across India registered an 18% growth in July sales as against the corresponding period in 2019, the Retailers Association of India (RAI) said on Wednesday. The growth is above the pre-pandemic levels. With 25%, the east India region saw the highest year-on-year growth, followed by the south at 21%, north at 16% and west at 10%, RAI said.

27.title: Shows on OTT don’t drag: Aly Goni on why he prefers OTT over TV
27.article_body: Actor Aly Goni opened up about why he loves to work more on OTT than TV and said, "shows on OTT don't drag". "They get over in...two or three months...you get time to be around your close ones," he stated. "[In] TV, you work many hours non-stop, but in OTT in a day, you shoot limited scenes," Aly added.

28.title: Don't see that 'at all': Reetinder on Kohli, Rohit opening in Asia Cup
28.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi said he doesn't see Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma opening in the Asia Cup "at all". "Kohli's best at number three...The talk is about positive intent...not...changing your game," added Reetinder. Discussing Team India's aggressive approach, Reetinder stated, "The...template is never that Kohli needs to hit a six off the first ball for India to score 200."

29.title: Stand up now and speak, Man Utd is in crisis: Ex-teammate Neville to Cristiano
29.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo's former teammate from Manchester United Gary Neville has asked the Portuguese forward to "stand up and speak" as the club is in "crisis". Ronaldo had recently said he'll reveal the truth about his situation "in a couple of weeks". "Why does the greatest player of all time have to wait two weeks to tell the truth?" asked Neville.

30.title: SBI opens 1st dedicated branch for startups in Bengaluru
30.article_body: State Bank of India opened its first-ever startup-dedicated branch in Bengaluru, which will offer services like funding, investment banking and treasury operations. The startup branch is located in Koramangala. The branch comes under a pact between the Karnataka government and SBI to further boost the state's startup ecosystem.

31.title: Ujjivan Small Finance Bank hikes interest rate on fixed deposits
31.article_body: Ujjivan Small Finance Bank has increased the interest rate on fixed deposits by up to 1.5% with effect from August 9, 2022. The bank has raised the rate by 0.3-1.50% across different tenures on the occasion of the 75 years of India's Independence. It also introduced tenures of 75 weeks (525 days) and 75 months with 7.5% rate per annum.

32.title: Journalist Rana Ayyub moves Delhi HC against attachment of funds by ED
32.article_body: Journalist Rana Ayyub has moved the Delhi High Court against the attachment of her funds by Enforcement Directorate (ED). "Provisional attachment has expired after 180 days yet PMLA provisions (Adjudicating Authority) is continuing with proceedings", her plea stated. ED had provisionally attached her assets worth ₹1.77 crore. Ayyub is being investigated by ED in an alleged money laundering case.

33.title: Murder accused stabs woman head constable to evade arrest in B'luru
33.article_body: A 20-year-old murder accused allegedly stabbed a 45-year-old woman head constable to evade arrest in Bengaluru. The accused was out on bail and had skipped court, prompting the police to look for him. During the inquiry, officers learned the accused was planning a murder and he attacked the woman constable when the police attempted to arrest him.

34.title: Asian LNG price surges to its highest in 5 months amid fuel crunch
34.article_body: Asian prices of the spot liquefied natural gas (LNG) surged close to $60 per million British thermal units on Tuesday, its highest in five months. With Russia cutting gas supplies to Europe amid the war with Ukraine, Asian and European utilities are increasing efforts to secure LNG spot cargoes ahead of the winters when consumption is at its peak.

35.title: Bumrah shares pic with Harshal after being ruled out of Asia Cup
35.article_body: Team India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has shared a picture with pacer Harshal Patel. Both the pacers have been ruled out of the upcoming Asia Cup and are reportedly undergoing rehabilitation at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru. India have named only three pacers, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Arshdeep Singh and Avesh Khan, in the 15-member squad for the Asia Cup.

36.title: ₹1.3 crore in Bitcoin extorted from businessman in Lucknow; 3 arrested
36.article_body: Police arrested three people in Uttar Pradesh for allegedly kidnapping and extorting ₹1.3 crore in Bitcoin from a businessman in Lucknow. The accused had taken the victim to Barabanki under the pretext of showing him a plot of land. The victim was then taken to a house, held hostage and tortured till he revealed his password and transferred the amount.

37.title: Skye Air, Flipkart Health to deliver medicines through drones in Kolkata
37.article_body: Drones startup Skye Air has partnered with Flipkart Health to deliver medicines through drones in Kolkata. Under this pilot programme, there will be 20 flights everyday, each carrying a load of 5 kilograms, from the warehouse to 10 different locations. The flight will cover an aerial distance of 16 kilometres and optimal flight safety will be ensured, Flipkart Health said.

38.title: 40-yr-old woman killed after getting hit by Delhi Fire Service truck
38.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was killed after being hit by a Delhi Fire Service truck, which was on its way back after attending a fire call on Wednesday morning in Delhi's Raj Park, police said. The incident took place when the deceased was going to work, police said. DCP (outer) Sameer Sharma said that she was lying under the rear tyre.

39.title: 1.4 kg ivory carving worth ₹2.5 cr seized in Thane, 2 arrested
39.article_body: Police seized an ivory carving worth ₹2.50 crore from Thane and arrested two persons on the charge of smuggling elephant tusks, an official said on Wednesday. Crime unit-I of the city police seized the ivory piece weighing 1.4 kg from Kalwa on Tuesday. "An image of a woman along with some design was carved on the tusk," the official added.

40.title: No directions given to provide flats to Rohingya illegal migrants in Delhi: Centre
40.article_body: The Centre has clarified it has not given any directions to provide EWS flats to Rohingya illegal migrants in Delhi. The Centre added that Delhi government had proposed to shift Rohingyas to a new location, but it asked Delhi government to ensure they are kept at their present location as the MHA has taken up the matter of their deportation.

41.title: Apple may fire a worker over her video on security advice for iPhones: Reports
41.article_body: Apple has reportedly threatened to fire an employee who posted a TikTok video identifying herself as its employee and giving viewers security advice regarding their iPhones. She had posted a video as a response to a user who had lost her iPhone and received threatening messages over data leak. Her video generated over 5 million views in just 24 hours.

42.title: Situation in Sri Lanka stabilised, no need to extend emergency: Prez
42.article_body: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe said the country will not extend a state of emergency imposed to control anti-government protests, adding the situation has "stabilised". The emergency, which was imposed by Wickremesinghe after ex-President Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled Sri Lanka in mid-July, is due to lapse on Thursday. However, Wickremesinghe has the power to renew it every month thereafter.

43.title: Observed how H'wood brings storytelling alive: Ayan on 'Brahmastra'
43.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji, speaking about his inspiration behind 'Brahmastra', has said that he observed closely "how Hollywood was regularly using technology to bring their storytelling alive as blockbuster cinema". He added that he was "deeply affected" by the stories his father used to tell about Hindu Gods and Goddesses. Ayan stated he's proud that 'Brahmastra' is a very original film.

44.title: Declare Basti, eastern UP as drought-hit: BJP MP in letter to CM Yogi
44.article_body: BJP MP Harish Dwivedi has asked UP CM Yogi Adityanath to declare Basti and eastern UP as drought-hit amid deficit rainfall. In a letter, Dwivedi said farmers were under stress because they haven't been able to sow paddy due to the weather conditions. Earlier, a BJP MLA made a similar request for Shahjahanpur district, asking government to launch relief operations.

45.title: Hyderabad airport to use DigiYatra platform for hassle-free travel
45.article_body: The DigiYatra platform will be rolled out at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport from August 18 for three months, the GMR Hyderabad International Airport said. The platform facilitates paperless travel by using facial recognition at two checkpoints for seamless and hassle-free travel. The checkpoints will be at the Departure Domestic Entry Gate 3 and at the Security Hold Area (SHA).

46.title: 55-yr-old cyclist crushed under truck while dodging potholes in Thane
46.article_body: A 55-year-old cyclist, identified as Sayeed Abdul Pathan, was allegedly crushed under the rear wheels of a container while trying to dodge potholes on Thane's Wada Bhiwandi Road. The incident took place on Tuesday, when Sayeed was on his way to the market, riding towards Wada Taluka. Eyewitnesses said Sayeed fell on the right side while failing to dodge potholes.

47.title: Why nobody raises voice when Kings of B'wood boycott outsiders: Vivek Agnihotri
47.article_body: Director Vivek Agnihotri took to Twitter to speak about 'Hinduphobia' and boycott culture in Bollywood and said, "Why nobody from Bollywood raises voice when the Kings of Bollywood boycott, ban and destroy careers of so many outsider actors, directors, writers?" He added, "The day...Indians get to know the...fascism and Hinduphobia of...dons of Bollywood, they'll drown them in hot coffee."

48.title: I get along with women more than men: Anurag on directing women-led films
48.article_body: Anurag Kashyap, speaking about directing women-led films, has said that he gets along with women more than men. "Women are easier to work with...Male insecurity is so much more," he added. He further said he gets a lot of trust from actresses like Taapsee Pannu, Saiyami Kher and Amruta Subhash. "I can't work if I don't get trust," he stated.

49.title: Govt to distribute 6 lakh clay idols for Ganesh Chaturthi in Hyderabad
49.article_body: Several departments in Hyderabad are reportedly getting ready to distribute over six lakh clay idols ahead of the upcoming Ganesh Chaturthi festival. The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) will reportedly distribute four lakh clay idols, while Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) and Telangana State Pollution Control Board (TSPCB) will distribute one lakh idols each.

50.title: The All New Hot & Techy Brezza is here, in a new avatar: Maruti Suzuki
50.article_body: Maruti Suzuki shared that its all-new hot and techy Brezza enables its young audience to embark on city adventures. The car is equipped with features like Head Up Display, Electric Sunroof, 360 View Camera, Dual LED Projector Headlamps with Floating LED DRLs, LED Tail Lamps, and dual-tone exteriors and more. The city-bred SUV is priced at ₹7.99 lakh

51.title: Female teacher set on fire in front of public in Rajasthan, locals take videos
51.article_body: A 32-year-old female teacher was set on fire by criminals in full public view near Rajasthan's Jaipur, with locals seen taking videos of the act. The victim had loaned money to the accused and had been demanding it back, reports said. The accused would hit and abuse her for demanding money back, reports added. The woman succumbed to her injuries.

52.title: You want to ask me that question, come to India: Jaishankar to Tamil man in Thailand
52.article_body: While interacting with the Indian community in Bangkok, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar  was asked about the Centre-state conflict in reference to Tamil Nadu by a Tamil man. EAM Jaishankar replied, "I don't get into Indian politics when I go abroad. You want to ask me that question, come to India and I will be very happy to answer."

53.title: 31-year-old businesswoman stabbed to death at her shop in Pune
53.article_body: A 31-year-old businesswoman named Pooja Devi Prasad was stabbed to death on Tuesday by an unknown person in Pune's Bhosari, police said. The accused stabbed Pooja at her cloth shop 'Pragati Collection' shortly after she opened it on Tuesday morning. After being stabbed, Pooja tried to catch the assailant and chased him for some distance before he escaped, police said.

54.title: MP Minister, relatives escape unhurt after truck rams into his car
54.article_body: A truck rammed into the official car of MP Minister Tulsi Ram Silawat when he was travelling to Bhopal with his family members, but all of them escaped unhurt, a police official said. The truck hit the car from the side, which left the left side door of the vehicle damaged, he added. The truck driver was detained.

55.title: 19-yr-old served spiked drink, gang-raped after birthday party in UP
55.article_body: A 19-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped after a birthday party on Sunday in Ghaziabad's Modinagar town in Uttar Pradesh, police said. Somebody served her drink laced with sedatives, police added. Later, a man took her to a room and also called his friends and they took turns allegedly raping her, police further said. All three accused have been arrested.

56.title: There was a 'communication gap': Asgar on fallout with Kapil Sharma
56.article_body: Discussing his fallout with comedian Kapil Sharma, having quit 'The Kapil Sharma Show' in 2017, comedian Ali Asgar said, "There was a communication gap." Kapil had earlier stated that he would "block" Asgar as he didn't know the reason behind him leaving the show. Talking about his exit from the show, Asgar stated, "I can't cheat as an artiste."

57.title: Kamal Haasan drops hint on 'Indian 2' on director Shankar's b'day
57.article_body: In a tweet wishing director Shankar on his birthday, Kamal Haasan dropped a hint on 'Indian 2'. Calling Shankar a director who "made heads turn" with his films, Kamal wrote, "Let's take pride as 'Indian'. Together let's achieve more." 'Indian 2' went on floors in 2019 but the shoot was put on hold due to an accident in 2020.

58.title: Traffic movement to be slow at several places in Mumbai due to Motorbike rally
58.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police has announced that the vehicular movement will be slow at several places in Mumbai between 12.30 pm to 4 pm due to Motorbike rally. Taking to Twitter, Mumbai Traffic Police wrote, "Vehicular movement will be slow between International Airport-WEH-Milan Subway-Vakola Bridge-Kherwadi Bridge-Kalanagar Bridge- Bandra Stn-Hotel Avsari Jn-Shivaji Park- Chaityabhoomi."

59.title: Not Ananya, Jahnvi was the 1st choice for 'Liger': Director Puri Jagannadh
59.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh has revealed that his first choice for 'Liger', opposite Vijay Deverakonda, was Janhvi Kapoor and not Ananya Panday. "I am a big fan of Sridevi Ji. And I wanted to cast Janhvi for the role. But then the dates weren't available," Puri said. Filmmaker Karan Johar later suggested him to cast Ananya Panday in the film.

60.title: Karnataka to provide 2% reservation to sportspersons in all state depts
60.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai on Tuesday announced that his government will provide two per cent reservation in all state departments to sportspersons on the lines of the existing quota in the police and forest department. The government has understood that the sportspersons need security for their lives, he said at a function organised to felicitate 75 sportspersons.

61.title: Vijay Deverakonda, Kartik Aaryan could be in my swayamvar: Kriti Sanon
61.article_body: Kriti Sanon, speaking about her potential swayamvar, said Vijay Deverakonda and Kartik Aaryan could be a part of it. Talking about Vijay, Kriti stated he's good-looking and sensible. She also named actor Aditya Roy Kapur to be a part of her potential swayamvar. Kriti added, "I'd love to work with Ryan Gosling...I'd also like him to be in my swayamvar."

62.title: Congress supporting anti-nationals all across the country: BJP leader
62.article_body: BJP MLA KS Eshwarappa on Wednesday said that Congress is not only supporting anti-nationals in Karnataka or South India, but all across the country. "I want to attack directly," the BJP leader said amid communal tension in Shivamogga. "The man who removed Savarkar's photo is an SDPI worker whose wife is a Congress councillor," Eshwarappa said.

63.title: 2 former Congress leaders join BJP ahead of Gujarat Assembly elections
63.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly elections, former Congress leaders Naresh Raval and Raju Parmar joined BJP in Gandhinagar on Wednesday. While Raval had served as Gujarat Home Minister in the then Congress government, Parmar was elected as Congress' Rajya Sabha member from Gujarat for three terms, between 1988 and 2006. Both the leaders had quit Congress nearly two weeks ago.

64.title: Concern is about spending public money in right way: SC on 'freebies'
64.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday heard a plea against practice of promising "freebies" during election campaigns. A bench headed by CJI NV Ramana said the concern is about spending public money in the right way. The court was hearing a petition by BJP leader and lawyer Ashwini Upadhyay seeking to prevent political parties from promising "freebies" to electorate before elections.

65.title: Man lured by high crypto profits loses ₹13 lakh to scammers in Pune
65.article_body: A pharmaceutical company's manager was cheated of around ₹13 lakh by cyber criminals, according to an FIR registered at Pune police station on Monday. Posing as a Bitcoin trading executive, a scammer lured the man into engaging in cryptocurrency trading by promising him high profits. He paid around ₹13 lakh to the scammers as commission or tax on his profits.

66.title: Tencent records its first-ever revenue drop in April-June quarter
66.article_body: China's Tencent on Wednesday reported its first-ever revenue decline, hurt by lack of game approvals, regulations limiting playing time and COVID-19 lockdowns. Tencent's revenue fell 3% YoY to 134.03 billion yuan ($19.78 billion) while its profit fell 56% YoY to 18.62 billion yuan ($2.74 billion) in April-June quarter. It also reported its first-ever shrink in workforce, which fell 4.7% QoQ.

67.title: You're an idiot: Geoffrey Boycott on England's 'Bazball' approach in Tests
67.article_body: Talking about England's attacking 'Bazball' approach in Test cricket, ex-England cricketer Geoffrey Boycott said, "If you think you're going to plunder the best bowlers [bowling] with a [new ball]...then you're an idiot." Boycott further said that England's top-order batsmen don't know how to play the new ball. "Job is to get through the new ball for your team," stated Boycott.

68.title: China orders factories to close amid worst heatwave in 6 decades
68.article_body: Authorities in several Chinese cities have ordered factories to temporarily close as the nation faces its worst heatwave in 60 years. Sichuan, a key manufacturing location for semiconductor industries, has ordered all factories to shut down for six days to ease the power shortage. Power cuts in Sichuan will reportedly hit factories belonging to some of the biggest electronic companies.

69.title: Central Railway to use bedsheets made by Pune's Yerawada jail inmates
69.article_body: Central Railway (CR) has decided to use bedsheets made by Pune's Yerawada Central Jail inmates. As a pilot project, 89 handmade bedsheets will be supplied to Mumbai CSMT-Nizamuddin Rajdhani Express and Pune-Ahmedabad Duronto Express. "It's being done on an experimental basis...after feedback from passengers...bedsheets will be made available on more such trains," an official said.

70.title: Was taking selfie, 100 people looked at me: Rahman on being only brown guy at H'wood party
70.article_body: Recalling attending a party thrown by Disney for their 2013 film 'Frozen', music composer AR Rahman said, "It was also the 90th birthday of Walt Disney so there was a statue of him." He added, "So...I was taking a selfie (with the statue), I look back and 100 people were looking at me. I was the only brown person there."

71.title: Railways considering semi-high speed track between B'luru, Hyderabad: Report
71.article_body: Indian Railways is considering building a semi-high speed track between Bengaluru and Hyderabad which may reduce travel time to less than 2.5 hours, according to reports. The track will reportedly be compatible for running trains at a speed of 200 km/hour. The track will be built between Bengaluru's Yelahanka Station and Hyderabad's Secunderabad Station, covering a distance of 503 km.

72.title: Country seeing difference between PM's words, deeds: Rahul on Bilkis Bano case
72.article_body: After 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment in Bilkis Bano gangrape case walked free in Gujarat, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi asked, "What message is being given to the women of the country by those who peddle lies about 'naari shakti'?" "Prime Minister Ji, the entire country is seeing the difference between your words and deeds," Gandhi added.

73.title: 14-yr-old abducts, rapes 3-year-old girl in a field in Haryana
73.article_body: A three-year-old girl was allegedly abducted and raped by a 14-year-old in a field in Haryana's Nuh district. The girl's mother was unaware that her daughter was following her to the field and didn't realise when the accused abducted her daughter. I heard my daughter crying when I was going to the field, the victim's father said.

74.title: 3 ex-Noida fire officers booked for issuing fire NOC to twin towers
74.article_body: Three former Chief Fire Officers (CFOs) of Noida have been booked over alleged irregularities in providing no objection certificate (NOC) to Supertech's illegal twin towers in Noida Sector 93A. The action has been taken based on the report of the inquiry committee constituted under the chairmanship of DIG Fire Services. FIR has been lodged at Phase 2 police station.

75.title: Vijay Deverakonda's mother holds pooja for him & Ananya at Hyd home
75.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda's mother organised a pooja for him and his 'Liger' co-star Ananya Panday at their home in Hyderabad ahead of their film's release on August 25. Sharing photos from the pooja on Twitter, he wrote, "This whole month touring across India and receiving so much love already felt like God's blessing! But mummy feels we needed His protection."

76.title: ICC releases men's Future Tours Program for 2023 to 2027
76.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday released the men's 2023-2027 Future Tours Program (FTP) cycle. The 12 full members of the ICC will play a total of 777 international matches, including 173 Tests, 281 ODIs and 323 T20Is, in the 2023-2027 FTP cycle compared to the 694 in the current one. India will be playing 38 Test matches in 2023-2027 FTP cycle.

77.title: Nitin Gadkari, Shivraj Singh Chouhan dropped from BJP's Parliamentary Board
77.article_body: The BJP on Wednesday dropped Union Minister Nitin Gadkari and Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan from its Parliamentary Board, the party's highest organisation body. BS Yediyurappa, Sarbananda Sonowal, Iqbal Singh Lalpura, Satyanarayan Jatiya, K Laxman and Sudha Yadav were included in the Board. The Board, headed by JP Nadda, also has PM Narendra Modi, Rajnath Singh and Amit Shah.

78.title: Kashmiri Hindus protest in J&K's Budgam over targeted killings
78.article_body: A group of Kashmiri Hindus on Wednesday staged a protest in J&K's Budgam district after Kashmiri Pandit Sunil Kumar was killed by terrorists on Tuesday. Demonstrators reportedly demanded justice for Sunil's family and asked to be relocated to safer places. "Terrorists...made it clear...they're going to kill all...Kashmiri Pandits," said Kashmiri Pandit Sangarash Samiti (KPSS) chief Sanjay Tickoo.

79.title: Philips CEO Frans van Houten to be replaced amid ventilators recall
79.article_body: Philips Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Frans van Houten will step down from the post, the Dutch health technology firm said on Tuesday. He will be replaced by Roy Jakobs, the head of the company's Connected Care businesses, on October 15. This comes after a recall of its ventilators cut Philips' market value by more than half over the past year.

80.title: Singer jumps 16% after Jhunjhunwala's firm buys 42.5 lakh shares
80.article_body:
Shares of Singer India jumped over 16% in early trade on Wednesday after late billionaire investor 
Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's RARE Investments bought 42,50,000 shares in the company. Singer's shares had hit the upper limit on Tuesday. RARE Investments bought the shares at ₹53.50 apiece after Retail Holdings India BV sold about 22% stake in the firm through bulk deals.

81.title: I don't know: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Law Minister Kartikeya Singh facing arrest
81.article_body: Commenting on Bihar Law Minister Kartikeya Singh's allegedly outstanding arrest warrant, CM Nitish Kumar said that he has no information about the same. "I do not know," Nitish told reporters. Singh and 17 others are accused in a 2014 kidnapping case. "Is Nitish trying to take Bihar back to Lalu's times?" BJP's Sushil Kumar Modi remarked.

82.title: Request PM to reverse Guj govt’s order: KTR as Bilkis rape convicts walk free
82.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao has requested PM Narendra Modi to intervene in a matter where 11 life imprisonment convicts in Bilkis Bano gangrape case were released from Godhra sub-jail under Gujarat government's remission policy. "I request PM to…reverse Gujarat government’s order...it's sending out a wrong message that a rapist walks out of jail and is welcomed," Rao added.

83.title: Zinc soars as Nyrstar's Budel smelter announces halt in production
83.article_body: After Nyrstar's Budel smelter announced it would halt production from September 1, zinc prices surged nearly 7.2% on the London Metal Exchange on Tuesday. Budel smelter, which is one of the largest in Europe, has been operating at a reduced rate since Q4 of the last fiscal because of soaring energy prices. Smelters require high amounts of electricity to operate.

84.title: Google showcases AI robots that fetch soda, chips
84.article_body: Google has showcased AI robots that help its employees fetch soda and chips from breakrooms with ease. The robots are not ready for sale. "It's going to take a while before we can really have a firm grasp on the direct commercial impact," Google said. The company has not yet embedded them with the "OK, Google" summoning feature.

85.title: I’m happy to be essaying realistic police officer: Drashti on 'Duranga'
85.article_body: Actress Drashti Dhami, speaking about her upcoming OTT series 'Duranga', said she is happy to play a realistic police officer. "I feel more people will be able to resonate with my character because she's a wife and mother at home and a cop at work," she added. 'Duranga' is an adaptation of the South Korean drama 'Flower of Evil'.

86.title: Holiday over, work begins: Kartik as he returns to 'Shehzada' sets
86.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan took to Instagram Stories and shared a selfie as he returned to the sets of his upcoming film 'Shehzada'. Along with the picture, he wrote, "Chutti khatam, kaam shuru (Holiday over, work begins)." The film, which is directed by Rohit Dhawan, will also feature actress Kriti Sanon. The actor recently featured in Anees Bazmee's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

87.title: There hasn't been a more important series than this Asia Cup for Kohli: Sodhi
87.article_body: Former India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi has said that there hasn't been a more important tournament than the upcoming Asia Cup for Virat Kohli in recent years. "Fingers crossed, we all are praying that we see Virat Kohli in excellent form in the Asia Cup," added Sodhi. Virat has been on break since India's tour of England.

88.title: After Ghulam Nabi Azad, 3 more leaders quit J&K Congress posts
88.article_body: After Ghulam Nabi Azad, three more senior Congress leaders quit the party's newly formed committees in Jammu and Kashmir within hours of being nominated. The other leaders include two-time MLA from Sopore, Haji Abdul Rashid, Mohammad Amin Bhat and Gulzar Ahmed Wani. Azad was made Jammu and Kashmir campaign committee chairman and was also named on the political affairs committee.

89.title: SRK said he would've done my role if he was younger: Vijay on Darlings
89.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma, who played the role of an abusive husband in 'Darlings', with Alia Bhatt portraying his wife, said actor Shah Rukh Khan stated he would have done the role "if he was younger". Vijay had earlier shared that SRK "thanked" him for doing the film. However, Vijay admitted that he thought his career will "end" following this portrayal.

90.title: Bengaluru-based Exponent Energy raises $13 mn in Series A round
90.article_body: Bengaluru-based electric vehicle charging infrastructure company, Exponent Energy, has secured $13 million in a Series A funding round. The round was led by Lightspeed Venture Partners and saw participation of existing investors like YourNest Venture Capital, 3one4 Capital and AdvantEdge Founders. The company had raised $6 million in seed and Pre-Series A funding round in December 2021.

91.title: Red panda, leopard skins recovered from North Bengal, 3 arrested
91.article_body: Two red panda skins and one leopard skin were seized from three wildlife traffickers in North Bengal’s New Jalpaiguri on Tuesday, officials said. The three arrested accused are citizens of Nepal. "All three are habitual offenders. They...entered India with skins from Nepal and were going to...Bhutan where consignment was to be delivered for ₹30 lakh," a senior forest official said.

92.title: UK inflation surges to 10.1% in July, its highest in 40 years
92.article_body: British consumer price inflation surged to 10.1% in July, which is the highest it has been since February 1982, data from the Office for National Statistics showed on Wednesday. The figures showed that prices rose by 0.6% in July from June on a non-seasonally adjusted basis. The annual retail price inflation rate reached 12.3%, the highest since March 1981.

93.title: BEST's 1st e-double-decker bus likely to be in public service from Sept: Report
93.article_body: Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport's (BEST) first electric double-decker bus in Mumbai is expected to be commissioned for the public in September 2022, as per a report. The first double-decker electric bus will likely be unveiled on 18 August 2022, the report said quoting sources. The prototype electric double-decker bus is ready with all necessary permissions, the reports added.

94.title: Arvind Kejriwal launches 'Make India No. 1' mission
94.article_body: Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal has launched the 'Make India No. 1' mission. "We have to make India great again," Kejriwal said. "It has been 75 years of Independence. India gained a lot but there's...a question among people that several small nations that attained independence after us, surpassed us...Why did India lag behind?" Kejriwal added.

95.title: Nandan Nilekani interrupts interviewer to ask meaning of 'OG', video surfaces
95.article_body: A video has surfaced online wherein Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani could be seen interrupting an interviewer to ask the meaning of OG. While the interviewer referred to Infosys as the "OG for entrepreneurship in India", Nilekani interrupted and asked, "What is OG?", to which she clarified, "The original gangster." Commenting on the video, a user wrote, "What a sweet moment."

96.title: MP gets 1st Vistadome coach in Bhopal-Jabalpur Jan Shatabdi Exp
96.article_body: With the introduction of a Vistadome coach in Bhopal-Jabalpur Jan Shatabdi Express, Madhya Pradesh got its first Vistadome coach, railway officials said. Principal Secretary of the tourism and culture department, Sheo Shekhar Shukla, said that with this coach, tourists can enjoy the views of the hills, rivers and nature between the two cities. The coach is equipped with large windows.

97.title: 5 foreigners charged as mercenaries in Donetsk, 3 face death penalty
97.article_body: A Russia-backed court in Donetsk region has charged five foreign nationals with being mercenaries, out of whom, three face death penalty, according to Russian state media. The five foreign nationals from Britain, Croatia and Sweden were captured in and around Mariupol while fighting with Ukrainian forces. In June, Donetsk authorities sentenced two Britons and one Moroccan citizen to death.

98.title: Aadhaar number mandatory to get govt benefits and subsidies: UIDAI
98.article_body: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has said that if a citizen doesn't have an Aadhaar number, he/she may not be entitled to avail government subsidies and benefits. The UIDAI said that a citizen may avail the benefits, subsidies and services through alternate and viable means of identification along with Aadhaar enrolment identification number till Aadhaar number is assigned.

99.title: China's Sichuan limits power supply to homes, offices amid heatwave
99.article_body: Authorities in China's Sichuan province began limiting electricity supply to homes, offices and malls on Wednesday due to a power crunch triggered by heatwave and drought, state media reports said. Government offices have been asked to not set air conditioners lower than 26 Celsius (78.8°F). Commercial and recreational activities like fountain and light shows during night hours will be suspended.

100.title: My Test career was 'almost over' before it started: Lee on McGrath's prank
100.article_body: Discussing a prank played on him by ex-Australian player Glenn McGrath during his Test debut, ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said, "Adam Gilchrist was...telling me to...enjoy and while I was listening...McGrath...[tied] my shoelaces together." "When I hopped up, I fell over. My Test career was almost over before it started," added Lee. "McGrath...would always...[play] a practical joke," he stated.

101.title: ‘Vinash shakti’ won in Guj: Chidambaram on Bilkis rape convicts released from jail
101.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram said "vinash shakti" has won in Gujarat, after 11 life imprisonment convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case walked free in Gujarat. "Are you not shocked by pictures of 11 released men being welcomed with sweets?" Chidambaram tweeted. "Did the PM not know about the proposed action of the Gujarat government?" he asked.

102.title: N Korea fires 2 cruise missiles amid US-S Korea joint drill
102.article_body: North Korea fired two cruise missiles from the town of Onchon on Wednesday, a South Korean military source said. On Tuesday, US and South Korea kicked off a four-day preliminary joint drill in preparation for upcoming Ulchi Freedom Shield exercise. South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol said he's willing to provide phased economic aid to North Korea if it begins denuclearisation.

103.title: 5 of family, including 2 kids, killed as truck hits car near Pune
103.article_body: Five members of a family, including two kids aged four and seven, died and one person was severely injured when a container truck rammed into their car near Pune on Wednesday morning, police said. The incident occurred on Pune-Ahmednagar highway. Pune Police Superintendent Abhinav Deshmukh said the truck driver fled after the accident and search was on to arrest him.

104.title: Finland, Sweden's NATO bids will progress very quickly: Germany's Scholz
104.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has said Finland and Sweden's NATO bids will "progress very quickly", and members including Turkey will ratify them soon. "In Finland and Sweden, we are gaining two valued allies," Scholz said. The two Nordic countries that remained neutral during the Cold War, applied to join NATO after the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

105.title: 4,000 litres of adulterated milk seized in Gujarat's Rajkot: Police
105.article_body: Four thousand litres of adulterated milk was seized from a truck at a checkpoint in Gujarat's Rajkot, police said. "A truck was stopped during checking of vehicles and adulterated milk that was made from chemicals like sulfates, phosphates and carbonate oils was seized," Rajkot DCP Praveen Kumar Meena said. "Adulterated milk was being supplied for last four months," he added.

106.title: Lebanese man who held up bank to access his own savings released
106.article_body: A Lebanese judge ordered the release of a man who last week took staff at a Beirut bank hostage for accessing his frozen savings. Bassam al-Sheikh Hussein surrendered after being permitted to withdraw $35,000, which he termed necessary for paying hospital bills. A crowd had gathered during the hostage situation with many chanting, "Down with the rule of the banks!"

107.title: E Palaniswami's appointment as AIADMK General Secretary not valid: Madras HC
107.article_body: E Palaniswami's appointment as All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) General Secretary is not valid, Madras High Court said. Palaniswami has been the AIADMK General Secretary since July 11, 2022. AIADMK's O Panneerselvam had filed a plea against the party's July 11 General Council meeting. Notably, Palaniswami is also the Leader of the Opposition in the Tamil Nadu Assembly.

108.title: 'Award-winning' director turns bike taxi driver in B'luru; chat with customer goes viral
108.article_body: A Twitter user's thread about his conversation with a bike taxi driver in Bengaluru has gone viral. The user said that the driver, who lost his job during the coronavirus pandemic, is also an award-winning director. "Created a Mini-series by investing all savings. Series got a great response and won around 15 Film Fests," the user said about the driver.

109.title: Chinese woman sues colleague for breaking ribs while hugging, gets ₹1 lakh compensation
109.article_body: A Chinese woman sued her colleague after he allegedly broke three of her ribs while hugging her. She said that the male colleague gave her an extremely tight hug leaving her in discomfort. She received medical attention after the pain stayed for about five days. Subsequently, a judge ordered the co-worker to pay her 10,000 yuan (₹1.16 lakh) as compensation.

110.title: They need to respect my terms too: Russell on Simmons' 'can't beg' remark
110.article_body: Responding to WI head coach Phil Simmons' remark that he can't beg people to play for their country, all-rounder Andre Russell, who hasn't played for WI since November 2021, said he still wants to win at least one more WC for the Windies. "But...we're not agreeing on certain terms...they have to respect my terms as well," he added.

111.title: More resignations likely if attention not paid: Handa as Azad quits J&K Cong post
111.article_body: Following Congress’ Ghulam Nabi Azad’s resignation from the post of chairman of the J&K campaign committee, party leader Ashwani Handa said that the right message is not reaching the high command. "If they don't pay attention to this committee, more resignations are likely. Everyone is feeling neglected," Handa added. Azad resigned from the post hours after the appointment.

112.title: BJP-JJP coalition govt believes in event management: Ex-Haryana CM
112.article_body: Former Haryana CM and Leader of Opposition Bhupinder Singh Hooda said the BJP-JJP coalition government believes in "event management". He claimed Haryana was a "knowledge hub" when Congress was in power, however, now state universities are falling out of the top 100. "This is because...a non-performing government, which only believes in event management, is running the state," he added.

113.title: Ravi Shastri had 'very low' tolerance for failure: Dinesh Karthik
113.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said ex-Team India head coach Ravi Shastri had "very low" tolerance for failure. "He had a very low tolerance for somebody who would bat at a certain pace he did not like or someone who was doing very differently in the nets and in the match, he would go and bat differently," added Karthik.

114.title: He should've just pulled his hair: NBA star Hart on Nunez's headbutt
114.article_body: NBA player Josh Hart has tweeted that Liverpool's Darwin Nunez would have escaped without punishment, if he had "pulled" Crystal Palace defender Joachim Andersen's hair, rather than headbutting him. Hart was referring to Tottenham Hotspur's Cristian Romero getting away without a booking for pulling Chelsea defender Marc Cucurella's hair during a match. Nunez was sent off following his headbutt.

115.title: Bengaluru to face scheduled power cuts from August 17-19
115.article_body: Several areas in Bengaluru will face power cuts from August 17-19 between 10 am and 6 pm due to repair and maintenance work undertaken by the Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM). The areas that will be affected today include Alagatta, Kenchamma Naguhalli, Hosur, etc. Whereas, areas that will be affected on August 18 include Hanumanthapura, Marenahalli, Rangapura, etc.

116.title: Vijay Deverakonda arrives at 'Liger' event in auto-rickshaw, video surfaces
116.article_body: A video of actor Vijay Deverakonda arriving at the sets of a dance reality show in Mumbai for promoting his upcoming film 'Liger' in an auto-rickshaw has surfaced on social media. In the video, Vijay can be seen wearing a white outfit. Reacting to the video, a fan commented, "Real hero with no attitude...very humble."

117.title: Chocolates worth ₹17 lakh stolen from Cadbury godown in UP: Report
117.article_body: About 150 cartons of Cadbury chocolate bars worth ₹17 lakh were reportedly stolen from a godown in Chinhat area of Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. The incident occurred on the intervening night of Monday and Tuesday, the reports added. The godown was earlier the home of Cadbury distributor Rajendra Singh Sidhu, who recently shifted to an apartment in Gomti Nagar.

118.title: Jacqueline named as accused in ED chargesheet in ₹200 crore extortion case: Report
118.article_body: Jacqueline Fernandez has been named as an accused in the Enforcement Directorate's supplementary chargesheet filed in the ₹200 crore extortion case against conman Sukesh Chandrashekar, reports said on Wednesday. Reports said that she was aware of the extortion taking place. The ED had earlier attached ₹7.27 crore funds of Fernandez under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA).

119.title: Over 150 children dead in Zimbabwe measles outbreak
119.article_body: A measles outbreak in Zimbabwe has killed at least 157 children, with the death toll nearly doubling in less than a week, the government said. The total number of suspected measles cases nationwide has risen from 1,036 to 2,056 in just four days, Information Minister Monica Mutsvangwa said. Earlier, the government had blamed gatherings of religious sects for the outbreak.

120.title: 21-yr-old student from Puducherry dies of suspected drug overdose in Goa
120.article_body: A 21-year-old college student from Puducherry died of a suspected drug overdose at Goa Medical College and Hospital, a police spokesperson said. He was admitted to the hospital in serious condition on Tuesday, the spokesperson added. The youth had arrived in Goa along with his three friends on Saturday. However, his friends claimed he had not consumed any narcotics substances.

121.title: Anupam shares pics from David Dhawan's b'day party, says 'We're the best'
121.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher took to Instagram and shared pictures from filmmaker David Dhawan's birthday party. He posted pictures with David, Satish Kaushik, Shakti Kapoor, Chunky Panday and Rajpal Yadav. Along with the pictures, he wrote, "With birthday boy David Dhawan and my dearest friends who I have spent some memorable times with!! We are the best."

122.title: Apple suppliers to produce Apple Watch, MacBook in Vietnam: Report
122.article_body: Apple's suppliers are mulling over producing Apple Watch and MacBook in Vietnam for the first time, Nikkei Asia reported. According to reports, Apple suppliers Foxconn and Luxshare Precision Industry have started test production of Apple Watch and MacBook in Northern Vietnam. Apple has been shifting some areas of iPhone production from China to other markets, including India.

123.title: Woman dragged on road in snatching incident in Delhi; act caught on CCTV
123.article_body: A 46-year-old woman was dragged on the road when two bike-borne men pulled her bag in Delhi's Greater Kailash market. The incident, which took place on July 30, was caught on CCTV in which the woman can be seen falling down and being dragged. The victim was heading towards her guest house after having dinner when the incident happened.

124.title: Water level of Yamuna crosses warning level in Delhi
124.article_body: Water level of Yamuna river in Delhi crossed the warning mark of 204.5 metres today. The surge in water level happened after Haryana released more water from Hathnikund Barrage amid rains in the upper catchment areas, officials said. This is the second time water level crossed danger mark in August. Earlier on August 12, the river crossed 205.33 metres mark.

125.title: Sexual harassment complaint won't prima facie stand if woman wore provocative dress: Court
125.article_body: While granting anticipatory bail to social activist Civic Chandran in a sexual harassment case, a Kerala Court observed that the offence under Section 354A of the Indian Penal Code is not prima facie attracted if the woman is wearing "sexually provocative dresses". The court expressed disbelief that the physically disabled accused could forcefully put the complainant in his lap.

126.title: Oil prices recover from 6-month low as US crude oil stockpiles drop
126.article_body: With a drop in US oil and gasoline stockpiles, oil prices recovered from a six-month low and increased on Wednesday even as investors are assured of a resilient demand. Brent futures rose to $92.47 a barrel, while West Texas Intermediate futures increased to $86.80 a barrel. Crude stocks fell by 4,48,000 barrels for the week ended August 12, sources said.

127.title: Your healthy lifestyle starts with picking the right cooking oil: Oleev
127.article_body: Oleev Active with the goodness of olive oil is specially created to fulfil the demands of the modern lifestyle, said the brand. It has an Energocules formula that will ensure you stay active and energized throughout the day, it revealed, adding that after all, you are what you eat.

128.title: 'New TMC in 6 months' posters with Abhishek Banerjee's photos put up in Kolkata
128.article_body: Posters claiming that "new and reformed TMC will come into being in six months", with photographs of TMC National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee have been put up in various parts of Kolkata. The posters didn't have West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee’s photo. "Maybe some over-enthusiastic party workers put up posters with his quotes issued in past," TMC's Kunal Ghosh said.

129.title: She questions you which is 'very irritating': Kashyap on Taapsee Pannu
129.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, whose upcoming film 'Dobaaraa' stars actress Taapsee Pannu, said she "pushes" him a lot. "She questions you which irritates you a lot. Taapsee keeps needling till she gets an answer," added Kashyap. Kashyap jokingly stated that Taapsee was soft-spoken when they first met, adding that she barged into his room and yelled the next time they met.

130.title: Cricket would lose something fundamental if we watch T20s only: Hussain
130.article_body: Talking about the emergence of multiple T20 franchise leagues in the world, former England captain Nasser Hussain said, "Cricket would be losing something fundamental if the only format we watch is T20 franchise stuff." Hussain added, "One area of concern is the extent to which white-ball cricket is now getting hold of players at the start of their careers."

131.title: Sensex crosses 60,000 mark for 1st time in over 4 months
131.article_body: BSE Sensex on Wednesday crossed the 60,000 mark for the first time during intraday trade since April 5. Meanwhile, NSE Nifty is currently trading at 17,923. Notably, the benchmark indices had opened on a higher note amid positive global trends. On Sensex, NTPC, Hindustan Unilever, Bajaj Finance, Asian Paints, UltraTech Cement and Reliance Industries were among the gainers.

132.title: Was paid much less in 'Jurassic...' than the reports said: Bryce Dallas
132.article_body: Actress Bryce Dallas Howard revealed that she was paid "so much less" for the 'Jurassic World' franchise than the reports suggested. "When I started negotiating for [Jurassic World], it was 2014...it was a different world and I was at a great disadvantage," she said. She added, "Unfortunately, you have to sign up for three movies...so your deals are set."

133.title: Largest aircraft Airbus A380 to land in B'luru for 1st time in October
133.article_body: The Airbus A380, which is the world's largest aircraft, will be deployed on the Bengaluru-Dubai route for the first time starting October 30. Emirates airline will be operating the double-decker aircraft service to and from Bengaluru. The aircraft will have three-class configurations apart from premium cabins, offering seats in Economy Class, Business Class and First Class.

134.title: Work on 4 Metro stations in Pune to be completed by August 31
134.article_body: The Maha Metro has sped up work on four stations in Pune, including Deccan Gymkhana, Chhatrapati Sambhaji Udyan, Pune Municipal Corporation and Civil Court, and is expected to finish it by August 31. According to an official, work on all four stations is 80% complete. "We're committed to open...remaining sections...in the coming months," said Maha Metro's Managing Director Brijesh Dixit.

135.title: Shinde-led Maharashtra govt announces 3% rise in DA for 17 lakh employees
135.article_body: Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government on Tuesday announced a 3% rise in the dearness allowance (DA) payable to nearly 17 lakh government employees in the state. "This increase will be paid in cash from August 2022. Due to today's cabinet decision, the dearness allowance of state government employees will be increased from 31% to 34%," Shinde said on Tuesday.

136.title: 'Please leave me alone', says Bilkis Bano as 11 convicts in gangrape case walk free
136.article_body: A day after 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment for gangraping Bilkis Bano and killing seven members of her family walked free in Gujarat, she said, "Please leave me alone...I've offered 'duas' for the soul of my daughter Saleha." Her husband Yakub Rasool said Bilkis couldn't believe they walked free, adding, she first broke into tears and then went silent.

137.title: Boult's IPL contract is ₹8 cr, he'll make more money in T20 leagues : Ashwin
137.article_body: India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has said pacer Trent Boult, who recently gave up his central contract, will make more money by playing in the T20 leagues than what he'll make by playing for New Zealand. "For that professional and financial liberation, he's not signing the central contract," added Ashwin. Boult was bought by RR for ₹8 crore in IPL auction.

138.title: Kenya's opposition leader to challenge presidential poll result after losing
138.article_body: After Kenya's Deputy President William Ruto won the presidential election, opposition leader Raila Odinga said that he would pursue all legal options to challenge the outcome. As per the official tally, Ruto narrowly beat his rival Odinga with 50.5% votes. Odinga called the figures declared by the election commission as "null and void", and his supporters alleged rampant electoral malpractice.

139.title: Musk says he was joking about buying Manchester Utd, tweets 'Not buying any sports teams'
139.article_body: Responding to a Twitter user, the world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk clarified that he is not buying football club Manchester United. He wrote, "This is a long-running joke on Twitter. I'm not buying any sports teams." Earlier on Wednesday, Musk while commenting on a thread of political allegiances, tweeted, "I'm buying Manchester United ur welcome."

140.title: It's common; be it anything, trolling is always there: Vijay Deverakonda
140.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda opened up about social media trolling and said that it's an everyday thing. "It's common...Even before I became an actor, aunties...uncles used to troll about results, college, job, etc. and now it's social media trolling," he added. Vijay stated, "Be it anything, trolling is always there." Vijay will next be seen in 'Liger', which also features Ananya Panday.

141.title: Activist who opposed MP's Khargone bulldozer drive arrested under NSA
141.article_body: Muslim activist Zaid Pathan, who opposed the Madhya Pradesh government's Khargone bulldozer drive, has been arrested under the National Security Act (NSA). Pathan was arrested for allegedly disturbing communal harmony and posting objectionable posts on social media, Indore DM Manish Singh said. Khargone bulldozer drive had taken place following violence during Ram Navami processions.

142.title: T'gana Minister reviews arrangements for Ganesh festival in Hyderabad
142.article_body: Telangana Animal Husbandry Minister Talasani Srinivas Yadav on Tuesday reviewed arrangements for Ganesh festival in Hyderabad. During the meeting, Talasani asked officials to repair damaged roads related to the routes of Ganesh procession within stipulated period. Further, state Home Minister Mahmood Ali directed police officials to deploy additional forces and 'SHE Teams' in suspected areas.

143.title: Senior UN official visits Myanmar to meet military leadership
143.article_body: A senior United Nations official, Noeleen Heyzer, arrived in the capital of Myanmar, Naypyidaw, on Tuesday to meet the country's military chief Min Aung Hlaing. "She will focus on addressing the deteriorating situation and immediate concerns," UN said in a statement. A junta spokesperson said that Heyzer has not requested to meet former Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi.

144.title: Sri Lanka says it's not paying for ex-Prez Rajapaksa's expenses abroad
144.article_body: The Sri Lankan government said that it's not paying for the overseas stay of ex-President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who fled the country after mass protests. "All such expenses are borne by the personal funds of the former President," the Information Department said. Rajapaksa is currently in Thailand. He arrived in Thailand last week from Singapore after his short-term visit pass expired.

145.title: CNG price reduced by ₹4 per kg in Pune
145.article_body: Price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) has been reduced by ₹4 per kg in Pune starting today, the All India Petrol Dealers Association said. The CNG will now cost ₹87 per kg which was earlier priced at ₹91 per kg. The price reduction is done on account of a downward revision in the purchase cost of domestic natural gas.

146.title: Ten Hag would've got rid of every Man Utd player if he could: Ferdinand
146.article_body: With Manchester United winless in Premier League after 1-2 and 0-4 defeats against Brighton and Brentford respectively, ex-Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand said the club's manager Erik ten Hag would've "got rid" of every player if possible. "That's the dream scenario," he added. "When you don't have the balls to play, you don't deserve to get the shirt," stated Ferdinand.

147.title: Ghulam Nabi Azad quits J&K Congress post hours after appointment
147.article_body: Senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad resigned from the post of chairman of the Jammu and Kashmir campaign committee, hours after the appointment. He has also resigned from the party's Jammu and Kashmir political affairs committee. Azad cited health reasons while resigning, as per reports. Notably, the Congress campaign committee was newly constituted on Tuesday.

148.title: BMC blames illegal alterations for ceiling collapse in Mumbai's Mulund
148.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has blamed illegal alterations by the contractor for the collapse of ceiling in a residential building in Mumbai's Mulund East on Monday, which killed two senior citizens. The building was neither dilapidated nor dangerous but it was an old structure which was only up to ground floor for over 25 years, a senior official said.

149.title: Soaps can increase pimples, switch to Himalaya Neem Face Wash: Himalaya
149.article_body: Consumers use soap on their face, unaware that it can damage skin and increase pimples, revealed Himalaya. With its campaign, Himalaya aims to empower consumers with scientific knowledge to make right decisions. It urges consumers to trust science and switch to Himalaya Purifying Neem Face Wash claiming that it is 100% soap-free and clinically proven to prevent pimples from recurring.

150.title: Chat with soldier gave me power to do another film after Panipat: Arjun
150.article_body: Arjun Kapoor revealed he was unsure if he would be able to do 'Bhoot Police' after 'Panipat' failed and the theatres were shut due to lockdown. He added he met an army person when he reached Dalhousie for filming 'Bhoot Police'. "I was...broken...underconfident...I talked to him for three minutes...his words gave me the power to do that film," Arjun added.

151.title: All the Khans in B'wood are legends: Ektaa on boycott 'Laal...' trend
151.article_body: Producer Ektaa Kapoor has reacted to the Twitter trend calling for a boycott of Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "All the Khans in the industry (Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan)...especially Aamir, are legends. We cannot boycott them," she said. Ektaa added, "It is so strange we are boycotting the very people who've given the best of business in the industry."

152.title: Social imbalance, people with criminal antecedents: Sushil Modi on Bihar Cabinet
152.article_body: Following Bihar Cabinet expansion, Ex-Bihar Deputy CM and BJP leader Sushil Kumar Modi on Tuesday said the new Cabinet reflects social imbalance and it has faces with criminal antecedents. "Surendra Yadav, Ramanand Yadav and Lalit Yadav, who are these people…What message [does] Nitishji wants to give by including such people in the Cabinet?" Sushil Kumar Modi asked.

153.title: Sania Mirza's sister Anam, Mohammed Asaduddin blessed with a baby girl, name her 'Dua'
153.article_body: Tennis player Sania Mirza's sister Anam and ex-Team India captain Mohammed Azharuddin's son Asaduddin have been blessed with a baby girl. Sharing the news on Instagram, Anam revealed that they have named their first child 'Dua' and wrote, "She’s doing well and so am I. Please keep Our Dua in your duas." Anam and Asaduddin got married in December 2019.

154.title: India reports 9,062 new COVID-19 cases and 36 deaths in 24 hours
154.article_body: India has reported 9,062 new COVID-19 cases and 36 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active cases in the country went down to 1,05,058, while the daily positivity rate declined to 2.49%. India reported 15,220 recoveries in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 4,36,54,064.

155.title: 6 members of a family found dead at their home in Jammu
155.article_body: Six members of a family have been found dead under suspicious circumstances at their home in Jammu's Sidhra locality, police said. The bodies have been taken to the Government Medical College and Hospital in the city, the police told news agency PTI. Teams have arrived at the location and are investigating the incident, the police further said.

156.title: Sensex rises 64.90 points to open at 59,907, Nifty at 17,845
156.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in green on Wednesday with Sensex up 64.90 points at 59,907.11 and Nifty at 17,844.70 with a rise of 19.40 points. NTPC, Grasim Industries, BPCL, Hero MotoCorp and Eicher Motors were among the major Nifty gainers, while the stock of HDFC, HDFC Bank, Infosys, TCS and HCL Technologies slipped. Nearly 1,452 shares advanced and 450 shares declined.

157.title: Serena Williams loses to 19-year-old Emma Raducanu in Cincinnati
157.article_body: Twenty three-time singles' Grand Slam champion Serena Williams lost in straight sets to 19-year-old Emma Raducanu in her final WTA tournament at the Cincinnati Open. Raducanu won the game 6-4, 6-0 to move to the second round. "I can't believe I just played Serena...She's just such a legend," said Raducanu after the game.

158.title: I was asked by wife to see Arjun Reddy, stopped after 45 mins: Liger maker
158.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh, whose upcoming film 'Liger' stars actors Vijay Deverakonda and Ananya Panday, said he was "asked" by his "wife" to watch Vijay's film 'Arjun Reddy' which was criticised for toxic masculinity and being misogynistic. "I stopped after watching the movie for 45 minutes," added Jagannadh. "The reason is that...I felt he acted so honestly," he stated.

159.title: Pune records most deaths as swine flu infections rise in Maharashtra
159.article_body: Pune has recorded the most number of deaths at 13, as Maharashtra has witnessed a rise in the number of swine flu cases. Until mid-August, the state witnessed at least 1,449 swine flu cases out of which 43 patients have died so far. After Pune, Nashik has witnessed six deaths, followed by Thane at five and Nagpur at four.

160.title: Rishi Sunak pledges civil service overhaul if elected UK PM
160.article_body: Ex-UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak pledged a major overhaul of the country's civil service to create a "sharper, leaner" bureaucracy if he's elected as UK's next PM. "I'll strengthen civil servants' experience...allow ministers to bring in more external expertise, and bring in performance pay so we have a truly Rolls Royce service delivering for and accountable to...British people," Sunak said.

161.title: Pregnant woman finds knife in her Subway sandwich in UK; shares pics
161.article_body: A pregnant woman has demanded an apology after finding a sharp knife in her Subway sandwich in UK's Suffolk. A Subway spokesperson said that the chain made four attempts to contact Nerice Moyse to resolve the issue but got no response. The spokesperson also said that the staff apologised as soon as they were made aware of the discovery.

162.title: I don't think Dhawan being captain would've bothered KL Rahul: Kaif
162.article_body: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has said the change in captaincy for the Zimbabwe ODIs could have been "avoided". He added, "If India would have played this series under Shikhar Dhawan, as initially announced, I don't think it would have bothered KL Rahul." Kaif further said, "If someone has been announced as captain, he should remain as captain."

163.title: DMK strong in its ideology, won't compromise with BJP & RSS: Stalin
163.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM and DMK chief MK Stalin on Tuesday said his party is strong in its ideology and it won’t compromise with BJP and RSS. His statement came ahead of his Delhi visit. "There's a relationship between state and Union government and not between DMK and BJP. There's no relationship between parties' ideologies," Stalin added.

164.title: NTPC invites bids from banks to raise ₹5,000 crore term loan
164.article_body: State-run NTPC Limited floated a tender to raise a ₹5,000 crore term loan from banks and financial institutions. The power company will use the proceeds of the loan for capital expenditure, refinancing of loan and other corporate purposes. It added that the minimum loan amount offered by banks or financial institutions should be ₹500 crore or multiples of ₹500 crore.

165.title: DGCA imposes ₹25 lakh fine on 5 helicopter operators from Kedarnath
165.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) imposed a fine of ₹5 lakh each on five helicopter operators ferrying pilgrims to Kedarnath over irregularities in flying records, officials said. The DGCA also suspended officials of two other operators for three months over violation of safety norms, they added. The matter came to light after DGCA conducted an audit in June.

166.title: We're being open & honest about our interests: Jaishankar on India buying Russian oil
166.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar spoke about India's position on buying discounted Russian oil amid Moscow's ongoing war in Ukraine. He said, "We're not doing it in a defensive way. We're being very open and honest about our interests. I have a country which has a per capita income of $2,000...It's my obligation...to...ensure that I get [people] the best deal."

167.title: US President Biden signs $740-billion climate change, healthcare and tax bill into law
167.article_body: US President Joe Biden has signed a $740-billion climate change, healthcare and tax bill into law. The package, known as the Inflation Reduction Act, includes provisions that increase taxes on large corporations, address climate change and lower prescription drug costs. The estimated $740-billion package is made up of $440-billion in new spending and $300-billion towards easing deficits.

168.title: CNG price reduced by ₹6 per kg, PNG by ₹4 per SCM in Mumbai
168.article_body: Mahanagar Gas has reduced the prices of automobile fuel Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) and kitchen fuel Piped Natural Gas (PNG) in Mumbai. CNG price has been cut by ₹6 per kg and it will now cost ₹80 per kg. PNG price has been cut by ₹4 per standard cubic metre (SCM) and it will now cost ₹48.50 per SCM.

169.title: Bengaluru's Shivananda Circle flyover partially opens for commuters
169.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Monday opened one stretch of Shivananda Circle flyover for public as a trial run. Earlier, the flyover was expected to be inaugurated on August 15, however, due to recent rainfall, asphalting work on the flyover had not been completed. According to an official, rest of the work will be finished in 12-15 days.

170.title: Swine flu cases increase in Thane, death toll reaches 9
170.article_body: The number of swine flu cases is continuously increasing in Maharashtra's Thane district with the total number of cases going up to 342 and nine succumbing to it. At present, 144 patients are undergoing treatment for swine flu in Thane district which include 112 from Thane, 22 from Kalyan-Dombivali, nine from Navi Mumbai and one from Thane rural.

171.title: Passenger train collides with goods train in Maharashtra's Gondia, over 50 injured
171.article_body: More than 50 persons were injured after three bogies of a train derailed in Maharashtra's Gondia around 2.30 am on Wednesday morning. The accident took place following a collision between a goods train and a passenger train. No casualties have been reported so far. The train was on its way from Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur to Rajasthan's Jodhpur.

172.title: 'This is life', says China on India's concern about its 'spy' ship in Sri Lanka
