346.title: Ratan Tata invests in startup founded by his business assistant for senior citizens
346.article_body: Ratan Tata has invested an undisclosed amount into Goodfellows, a startup founded by Shantanu Naidu which offers companionship as a service to senior citizens. Goodfellows hires graduates with emotional intelligence to work with senior citizens and has been working with 20 elders for the last six months in its beta phase. Notably, Naidu is the General Manager in Tata's office.

347.title: I urge PM Modi to interfere: Ex-player Barua on FIFA suspending AIFF
347.article_body: Former Indian footballer Anadi Barua has "urged" PM Narendra Modi and Sports Minister Anurag Thakur to "interfere", after FIFA suspended the All India Football Federation (AIFF). "AIFF needs many changes...If this is not done soon...it will be more harmful," added Barua. Bengaluru FC owner Parth Jindal had earlier stated that the "worst Olympic federation" is "better" than the AIFF.

348.title: Over 7.9 million enrolled under Baal Aadhaar from April to July: Govt
348.article_body: Over 7.9 million children, aged up to five, were enrolled under the Baal Aadhaar initiative from April to July, Electronics and Information Technology Ministry said. As many as 26.4 million children in the zero-five age group had been enrolled by the end of March, it added. "Baal Aadhaar works as a digital photo identity for children," the Ministry further said.

349.title: BMC to demolish over 100-yr-old dilapidated building in south Mumbai
349.article_body: Bombay HC has permitted Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation to demolish an over 100-year-old dilapidated building in south Mumbai and has directed its occupants to vacate the premises. The HN Petit Widows Home, which has five floors, was used to provide hostel facilities to widows. Due to the building's poor condition, the widows residing there were moved to another hostel in 2019.

350.title: Bengal dengue cases up 7 times till August 1st week as compared to last year
350.article_body: Dengue cases shot up nearly seven times in West Bengal till August first week as compared to last year. According to state Health Department, around 450 dengue cases were detected till first week of August in 2021. However, this year, the number has shot up to 3,104 during same period. The Health Department has submitted a report to chief secretary.

351.title: China announces new military drills as US delegation visits Taiwan
351.article_body: China announced more military drills on Tuesday after a five-member US delegation met Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen. Beijing has not revealed where and when the drills would be conducted. On Monday, Tsai said that her administration was working with allies to ensure stability in the Taiwan Strait, however, China accused US of trying to change the ''One China'' policy.

352.title: Gunmen kill 2 policemen escorting polio workers in Pakistan
352.article_body: Motorcycle-borne gunmen on Tuesday opened fire on police escorting a team of polio workers in northwestern Pakistan, killing two policemen, authorities said. The assailants fled the scene and no one group has claimed responsibility for the attack in Gomal town so far. The attack took place on the second day of Pakistan's latest anti-polio campaign in the province.

353.title: Delhi HC reserves order on PIL for Satyendar Jain’s disqualification
353.article_body: The Delhi HC reserved the order on a PIL seeking direction to disqualify Satyendar Jain from the Assembly and the Cabinet due to his 'memory loss' issue. The plea said that the government is violating Constitution's clause that specifies that a person shall be disqualified if he/she is of unsound mind and declared the same by a court.

354.title: Hyderabad man hangs himself on video call with wife
354.article_body: A 33-year-old Hyderabad-based man, Sai Karthik Goud died by suicide after an argument with his wife. The incident happened after Goud asked his wife to accompany him to his parents' house to celebrate Bonalu but she refused. Irritated over their argument, Goud put a noose around his neck and made a video call to his wife and hanged himself.

355.title: Menswear has changed drastically: Kunal Rawal on 15 yrs in fashion
355.article_body: Designer Kunal Rawal, who recently completed 15 years in the fashion industry, said menswear has "changed so drastically" and for the better. He said menswear is "far more democratic" now. "In the last few years, India has been more progressive and you have the strongest correlations. So, that is a big part of inspiration," he added.

356.title: I will try to 'outdo' Rishabh Pant in the boundary count: Ryan Burl
356.article_body: Zimbabwe's Ryan Burl, who recently smashed 34 runs in an over, in the third T20I against Bangladesh, said he will try and "outdo" Rishabh Pant in the boundary count during the ODI series against India. "I...see myself in Pant," added Burl. Burl earlier stated he was trying to "emulate" Yuvraj Singh in the over where he smashed 34 runs.

357.title: Maybe Ponting suffered jet lag: Salman Butt on 'Surya is like ABD' comment
357.article_body: Reacting to Ricky Ponting's comment that India batter Suryakumar Yadav is like former South Africa batter AB de Villiers, ex-Pakistan captain Salman Butt said that the comparison was a "bit too much". Butt added, "Suryakumar is yet to play in big tournaments...[and] the fact is nobody has ever played cricket like De Villiers....maybe Ponting suffered a jet lag."

358.title: Scientists develop smart contact lenses that can diagnose cancer
358.article_body: Scientists from the Terasaki Institute for Biomedical Innovation have developed smart contact lenses that can potentially screen and diagnose cancer. This lens can capture and detect exosomes, nanometer-sized vesicles found in tears, which have potential for being diagnostic cancer biomarkers. This may serve as an inexpensive screening programme for multiple types of cancer, researchers said.

359.title: 2 e-scooters catch fire, explode in Hyderabad
359.article_body: Two electric scooters caught fire as their batteries exploded while charging in Hyderabad on Monday. The owner of the vehicles T Haribabu said that he had recently purchased both electric scooters and he had put them on charge in front of his house. An hour later, he heard a loud explosion and saw both the two-wheelers engulfed in flames.

360.title: India's WPI inflation eases to 13.93% in July: Ministry data
360.article_body: India’s wholesale inflation declined to 13.93% in July, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry data showed. The Wholesale Price Index (WPI) based inflation has been in the double-digit for 16 months now. The rise in prices of mineral oils, food articles, crude petroleum and natural gas and electricity, among other things, contributed to inflation in July 2022, the ministry said.

361.title: 'Laal Singh…' is a piece of art, Aamir is pure genius: Neha Dhupia
361.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia has called Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha" a "piece of art". Calling Aamir a "pure genius", Neha requested fans to not fall for the boycott trend and make time to watch the film. She said the film is like magic that "transports you into a world where only goodness exists, truly and purely because its only heart".

362.title: 5 more ships depart from Ukraine under grain export deal: Turkey
362.article_body: Five more ships with corn and wheat have departed from Ukraine's Black Sea ports under the grain export deal signed last month, Turkey's Defence Ministry said on Tuesday. Another four ships headed for Ukraine were to undergo inspection on Tuesday by the joint co-ordination centre set up under the deal in Istanbul, the ministry added.

363.title: Pune Metro to extend till Dapodi, Deccan Gymkhana after I-Day trial run
363.article_body: After successful trial runs on August 15, Pune Metro is all set to expand from Garware College to Deccan Gymkhana and from Phugewadi to Dapodi, officials said. "The successful trial run on these routes have paved the way for extending the service till Shivajinagar on Reach 1 and Civil Court on Reach 2," public relations officer of Pune Metro said.

364.title: What is China's 'Yuan Wang 5' ship, being closely watched by India as it reaches SL?
364.article_body: India had earlier said it's 'monitoring the movements' of the Chinese surveillance ship 'Yuan Wang 5' which has now arrived in Sri Lanka. China uses the Yuan Wang class ships to track satellite and ballistic missile launches. It's in Lanka to do satellite control and research tracking of Chinese satellites. Reports suggested south Indian ports could be surveilled by it.

365.title: Kerala man launches 30,000-km solo bicycle ride to London on I-Day
365.article_body: On the occasion of Independence Day on Monday, a 34-year-old man from Kerala embarked on a solo cycle expedition from Thiruvananthapuram to spread the message of peace among countries. As per the itinerary, Faiz Ashraf Ali will cover 30,000 km and 35 countries on a bicycle and reach his destination, London, in 450 days. He'll travel from Mumbai-Oman by air.

366.title: Hotter summers fuelled by climate change may increase skin cancers: Experts
366.article_body: Higher summer temperatures caused due to climate change may lead to more cases of melanoma, one of the most serious types of skin cancer, say experts. "Melanoma is caused essentially by sunburn, and this weather is so extreme that I am concerned that sunburns will increase and...so will the incidence of melanoma," Julia Newton-Bishop, a clinician scientist, said.

367.title: Housing prices rise by 4% in April-June quarter in Bengaluru: Report
367.article_body: Housing prices in Bengaluru increased by 4% to ₹7,848 per square foot in April to June quarter as compared to last year, a report by CREDAI, Colliers and Liases Foras said. Bengaluru also saw the highest dip in unsold inventory of 21% on year-on-year basis, the report said, adding that prices rose by 4% in the city's outer south region.

368.title: Tragic loss of precious lives: Prez condoles death of ITBP personnel in J&K
368.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Tuesday condoled the death of seven ITBP personnel who died after their bus fell into a river bed in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam. "The tragic loss of precious lives of ITBP personnel in the unfortunate accident at Anantnag, Jammu and Kashmir fills me with sadness. My heartfelt condolences for the bereaved families," the Rashtrapati Bhavan tweeted.

369.title: It's ludicrous to suggest Rushdie's responsible for attack on him: UK
369.article_body: The UK said it's "ludicrous" to suggest that author Salman Rushdie was responsible for the attack on him. This comes after Iran suggested that Rushdie had "exposed himself to...anger and rage of the people" by insulting Islamic sanctities and "crossing the red lines of over 1.5 billion Muslims". Rushdie was stabbed by a 24-year-old man in New York on Friday.

370.title: He made faces, talked in derogatory tone: Taapsee on argument with photographer
370.article_body: While talking about her recent video where she can be seen in an argument with a photographer at an event, actress Taapsee Pannu said that the photographer "kept making faces" at her and spoke to her in a derogatory tone. "I did not want to retaliate. I folded my hands and accepted whatever he had to say," she added.

371.title: Supreme Court to hear AIFF case tomorrow after FIFA's suspension
371.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday will hear the case related to the All India Football Federation (AIFF) after the Central government sought an urgent hearing in the matter following FIFA's suspension of the Indian football body. Solicitor General of India Tushar Mehta requested the urgent hearing, stating that "some development" has taken place in relation to AIFF.

372.title: Pakistan wants bloodbath in Kashmir: J&K BJP chief on killing of Kashmiri Pandit
372.article_body: J&K BJP chief Ravinder Raina on Tuesday condemned the incident where a Kashmiri Pandit was killed in Shopian after terrorists fired upon civilians. "Pakistan wants to turn Kashmir into graveyard...[It] wants a bloodbath in Kashmir...we won't allow it to fulfil its nefarious designs," Raina said. "Those involved in targeting Kashmiri Pandits...will be taken to task," he stated.

373.title: Online game chat helps Delhi Police reunite minor girl with family
373.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was reunited with her family by the Delhi Police after examining a conversation that took place in the online game, 'Free Fire'. The game's chat helped the police contact her friend, who informed the police that she had contacted him through an auto-rickshaw driver's phone, following which she was found at Gurudwara Bangla Sahib.

374.title: Woman poisons 3 daughters after spat with husband in UP
374.article_body: A woman poisoned her three daughters following a spat with her husband over a domestic issue in UP's Ghazipur. Two daughters died on the spot, while the third succumbed during treatment in the hospital, reports said. The police have registered a case for murder against the woman, who is in police custody, according to reports.

375.title: IIT Bombay reacts after being criticised for photoshopping Tricolour on campus in FB pic
375.article_body: IIT Bombay has reacted after being criticised for photoshopping the Tricolour on campus in a Facebook picture. "The picture of IIT Bombay Main Building with a flag was a depiction to commemorate Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav and not an actual photo. Our goal was to create the spirit of the Mahotsav. We regret the confusion this may've caused," it said.

376.title: Man shot, then stabbed to death during gambling session in Gujarat
376.article_body: A man died after he was shot in the stomach and later stabbed in the chest, neck and shoulder while he was gambling in Gujarat's Gandhinagar on Sunday afternoon. Police found playing cards at the murder scene and suspect the crime to be a fallout of some dispute. The deceased reportedly had an enmity with a local politician too.

377.title: Delhi man threatens mother-in-law at gunpoint, fires into wall; held
377.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested on Monday after he allegedly fired into the wall of his mother-in-law's house while threatening her at gunpoint when he went there to take his estranged wife home, the police said. An officer said that the accused had apparently fired in his mother-in-law's general direction. No one was injured in the incident, the police added.

378.title: Iran submits written response in 2015 nuclear deal talks: Reports
378.article_body: Iran has submitted a written response in the ongoing talks to restore 2015 nuclear deal. Tehran would not take the proposal mediated by the European Union, Iran's state-run news agency IRNA reported. "The differences are on three issues...the US...expressed...verbal flexibility in two cases, but it should be included in the text," the IRNA report said.

379.title: Karnataka minister says 'govt not functioning, somehow managing'; CM Bommai responds
379.article_body: Karnataka Law and Parliamentary Affairs Minister JC Madhuswamy has purportedly claimed that the state government is not functioning and added that the officials are somehow managing. Commenting on Madhuswamy's remarks, CM Basavaraj Bommai said the minister's statements were made in a "different context". Madhuswamy's remarks were revealed in an audio leak.

380.title: SS Rajamouli: Actor Manav Gohil on the person he last fantasised about
380.article_body: Actor Manav Gohil, who was seen in 'Baaghi 3' and 'Super 30', said in an interview that the last person he "fantasised" about was 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli. Manav added Brad Pitt is the same-sex actor he's crushing on, terming actress Raveena Tandon as his celebrity crush. Talking about the place where he first kissed someone, Manav named Sweden.

381.title: Aditya shouldn't sit in cave, dictate filmmakers: Anurag on Shamshera failing
381.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap opened up about 'Shamshera' failing at the box office and said that Aditya Chopra needs to empower filmmakers and not dictate them or control their casting. "You've one person sitting in a cave, who doesn't know the world outside, dictating how everybody should be making their films...telling them what to do," he said speaking about Aditya.

382.title: 2-time champion Murray beats Wawrinka to enter second round at Cincinnati Open
382.article_body: Ex-world number one Andy Murray defeated three-time Grand Slam champion Stanislas Wawrinka 7-6(7-3), 5-7, 7-5 in the first round at Cincinnati Open on Monday. The two-time champion will now face ninth-seeded Cameron Norrie, who beat Dane Holger Rune 7-6(7-5), 4-6, 6-4, in the second round. Unseeded Frances Tiafoe defeated 12th-seeded Matteo Berrettini 7-6(7-3), 4-6, 7-6(7-5) to reach second round.

383.title: You don't know what it's like to be lonely: Tata on investing in startup for senior citizens
383.article_body: Ratan Tata on Tuesday announced an undisclosed investment in GoodFellows, a startup founded by Shantanu Naidu that offers companionship to senior citizens as a service. "You don't know what it's like to be lonely until you spend time alone wishing for companionship," Tata said at the launch. He added no one cares about getting old until they actually get old.

384.title: Our domestic level is not that great in women's cricket: Harmanpreet Kaur
384.article_body: India Women captain Harmanpreet Kaur has said that the domestic level in women's cricket is not that great in India and the Women's IPL might help prepare girls for the international level. "[In] women's IPL...our domestic players will also get a chance to play with overseas players...they'll not feel that pressure...when they play international games," explained Kaur.

385.title: Part of body of boy who went missing after Kullu flash floods recovered
385.article_body: A part of the body of a boy who had gone missing after flash floods in Kullu has been recovered, news agency ANI reported. Another body was also found. Sub Divisional Magistrate of Manali said that around 100 people, including NDRF, police, fire brigade, team of administration and local volunteers deployed for rescue operations, were present on spot.

386.title: 5 men, minor boy repeatedly rape 17-year-old girl in Maha, arrested
386.article_body: Five men were arrested and a minor boy was detained for allegedly raping a 17-year-old girl repeatedly in Maharashtra's Aurangabad, police said on Tuesday. The victim's parents approached the police on Saturday, following which the five accused were arrested, a senior police official said. The accused were produced before a court, which sent them to police custody till August 17.

387.title: Class 12 girl returning from I-Day celebrations run over by bus in Chennai
387.article_body: A Class 12 girl, who was returning from Independence Day celebrations at school, was killed after being hit by a Metropolitan Transport Corporation (MTC) bus in Chennai on Monday. A CCTV footage shows the deceased student and her friend riding their bicycles on Rajendra Prasad Road when the bus passes by. The bus driver had surrendered on Monday, police said.

388.title: Aus city votes to remove 132-yr-old statue of grave-robbing politician
388.article_body: Australian city of Hobart in Tasmania voted to remove a 132-year-old statue commemorating a politician who stole the skull of an Aboriginal man from a local morgue and replaced it with that of another corpse. The removal of William Crowther's statue is a "part of the process of truth-telling" about the history of Tasmania, Hobart's Lord Mayor Anna Reynolds said.

389.title: Oscars apologises to actress Sacheen 50 years after she was booed off the stage
389.article_body: The Academy Awards has apologised to Native American actress Sacheen Littlefeather nearly 50 years after she was booed off the stage. At the 1973 Academy Awards, Littlefeather was heckled as she explained why Marlon Brando had rejected best actor award for 'The Godfather' on his behalf. Littlefeather later said actor John Wayne had to be restrained from physically assaulting her.

390.title: Dubai Crown Prince goes unnoticed while travelling in London metro, shares pics
390.article_body: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum, the Crown Prince of Dubai, travelled in the London metro (Tube) and went unrecognised. Sheikh Hamdan shared pictures of himself standing on a crowded train with his fellow commuters seemingly unaware of his identity. The pictures got over 10,000 comments, one of which said, "These poor people have no idea with whom they're travelling."

391.title: 6 Shrikant Tyagi's associates jailed for creating ruckus, granted bail
391.article_body: Six associates of politician Shrikant Tyagi, jailed for entering and creating ruckus at Grand Omaxe society in Noida, Sector 93 have been granted bail today. These associates had barged into the society and demanded the address of the woman who confronted Tyagi. Self-proclaimed politician Tyagi was arrested by Noida Police for molesting and abusing a woman.

392.title: Prem Watsa-backed Digit Insurance files draft papers for IPO
392.article_body: Bengaluru-based startup Go Digit General Insurance has filed draft papers with the SEBI for an initial public offering (IPO). The startup, backed by billionaire Prem Watsa's Fairfax Financial Holdings, will sell 10.9 crore shares in its offer-for-sale portion and issue new stock worth ₹1,250 crore through IPO. The company may also sell shares worth ₹250 crore in a pre-IPO placement.

393.title: Ancient watermelons tasted bitter and could kill you: Study
393.article_body: A study has found that watermelons cultivated around 6,000 years ago tasted bitter and could have also killed a person on consumption. Our ancestors removed the red flesh and only consumed the seeds of the fruit. Scientists believe the pungent taste of watermelon must have changed after domestication, as fruits tend to lose some of their traits during the process.

394.title: 4 people returning from Jagannath Temple rescued from floods in Odisha
394.article_body: Four pilgrims returning from Jagannath Temple were rescued after their car was stuck in floodwaters in Odisha's Cuttack district on Monday night. Notably, incessant rainfall for past few days led to flooding in Mahanadi river with water entering low-lying areas in Jajpur and Dasarathpur blocks. Earlier, eight gates of Hirakud dam were closed to prevent any large-scale flooding downstream.

395.title: Crypto lender Celsius' actual debt stands at $2.85 billion: Report
395.article_body: Filings from a new bankruptcy report have shown that crypto lender Celsius Network's actual debt stands at $2.85 billion, against their bankruptcy claims of a $1.2 billion deficit, Cointelegraph reported. The report states that Celsius has around $4.3 billion in assets against $5.5 billion in liabilities. Celsius had filed for bankruptcy after collapse in value of Terra USD.

396.title: DFM Foods shares hit 20% upper circuit on delisting proposal
396.article_body: The shares of DFM Foods Limited hit the 20% upper circuit on Tuesday for the second consecutive session to ₹304 apiece at opening trade on the BSE. On Monday, private equity firm Advent International, a majority stakeholder in DFM Foods via its subsidiary AI Global Investments, announced the proposal to delist the snack maker from the stock exchanges.

397.title: Amitabh Bachchan asks question about boAt on KBC 14, Co-founder Aman Gupta reacts
397.article_body: In a recent episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', Amitabh Bachchan asked a question about electronics brand boAt. Co-founder Aman Gupta, sharing a screenshot of the question, wrote on Instagram, "Aaj khush toh boAt hoge tum, Hainnn. Proud to see entrepreneurs and startups as General Knowledge questions." "Superb," Aman's Shark Tank India fellow judge Ashneer Grover commented on the post.

398.title: Amul, Mother Dairy to raise milk prices by ₹2 per litre from tomorrow
398.article_body: Amul has announced that it's increasing its milk prices by ₹2 per litre from August 17. The prices of Amul milk will be hiked in areas like Gujarat's Ahmedabad and Saurashtra, Delhi NCR, West Bengal, Mumbai and other markets where Amul markets fresh milk. Mother Dairy also announced that it is increasing milk prices by ₹2 per litre from tomorrow.

399.title: Ready to work with Centre to improve healthcare, don't call it freebie: Kejriwal
399.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Monday appealed to the Centre to not term free education and health care facilities as "freebies". "We are ready to work with the Centre to improve healthcare services and education…I offer central government to use our services," CM Kejriwal added. "All state governments can work together," CM Kejriwal said.

400.title: Grand Alliance is stronger with Nitish Kumar: Manoj Jha
400.article_body: Backing the RJD-JD(U) alliance in Bihar, MP Manoj Jha claimed that the “map of 2024 elections is clear” up to a great extent. “This entire Mahagathbandhan is stronger with Nitish Kumar coming into the alliance. So, the map of 2024 is clear up to a great extent,” said Jha. JD(U), earlier this month, formed a new government with RJD.

401.title: Manipur to add police outposts along Myanmar border to check infiltration
401.article_body: The Manipur government has approved a proposal to set up 34 new police outposts along the India-Myanmar border to check illegal immigration from Myanmar, said CM N Biren Singh. The outposts will come up between Jessami and Behiang villages. Singh was addressing an event at 1st Manipur Rifles Parade Ground in Imphal on the occasion of 76th Independence Day.
